page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES OF FLEET
page.content: PRINCIPAL FEATURES OF FLEET The block{04800153}is dominated by the town of{Fleet}which has approximately 28,000 inhabitants. Fleet is situated in North East Hampshire, 38 miles from London. The town has excellent road and rail services. The surrounding countryside on the grid is made up largely of pine and silver birch woods and heather commons. In the N.E. of the town lies{Fleet Pond,}and the {Basingstoke Canal}flows throughout the grid. The northern area of the grid is occupied by woods and farmland. Amongst the pine trees at Pyestock is the{National Gas Turbine Establishment and on the other side of the road is part of the{Royal Aircraft {Establishment.}Both are places where modern research takes place and they are major employers for the area.
